review_blob: Lots of toasted brown sugar in amber malts, overwhelming the hops. Inoffensive but more malt-forward than my tastes or my expectation so this project.
beer_name: Long Trail Smash Project #3 - Munich Malt/Single Hop Equinox

review_blob: Can from Brewtopia. Copper clear with small head. Caramel nuts peachy and citrus amber nuts grapefruit woody resin. Medium light. Definitely a throwback to 1995. Would have kicked ass then. Now, meh.

Can from Brewtopia. Near black with lasting tan head and a little lace. Nice roasted coffee chocolate nutty earthy aroma. Chocolate sweetness with just enough fruitiness to balance it. Earthy roasty bitterness with just enough wood and a touch of ash. Medium light body creamy. Really nice. If I was stuck drinking this all night, I wouldnt complain a bit.
beer_name: Millys Tavern General John Stark Porter

review_blob: Bottle from Craft Beer Cellar Waterbury. Hazy orange gold with white head and lace. Lemon pastry brett grass hay aroma (one of my favorites) with a little green grape or champagne. Tropical fruit pineapple apricot sweetness with grassy lemony grapefruit funk and dry bitter peppery grapefruit finish. NIcely attenuated soft carbo. Totally fucking amazing.
beer_name: Anchorage Bitter Monk Belgian Style Double IPA

review_blob: Bottle from Table and Vine. Murky goldish aith a few floaties with lasting flat dense head and a little lace. Very spicy clovey aroma with hints of orange and vanilla and booze. Sweet but not as fruit as expected just overwhelmed by spicy bitterness. Medium full body soft when it warms up. To spicy for my taste in tripels, which is one of my favorite styles, but still very good. Wish a had a few sips left.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Slightly hazy gold with ring head. Spicy clovey aroma with light lemon pastry and wet grass. Tropical fruit lemon with a touch honey sweetness spicy clovey lemon drop long bitterness. Medium body lacks soft mouthfeel. Not something I would use to introduce newbies, but a pretty solid and very spicy Belgian-style blonde.

Bottle. Hazy orange gold with some floaters (I got the bottom half) lasting head and lace. Toffee tangerine and spice aroma. Toffee bready sweatness with grapefruity hops in long toffee finish. Similar finish to Long Trail Spae Juice. Medium body. Soft carbo. Very good.

Bottle from Craft Beer Cellar Waterbury. Hazy pale gold with lasting head and lace. Wicked fresh tangerine citrus and floral aroma. Tropical fruit pineapple grassy sweetness with fairly mild fruity citrus finish with some grapefruit and spicy bitterness. Medium body nicely attenuated soft carbo. Just another fucking delicious IPA from these guys.

Bottle on disco from Table and Vine. Murky orange caramel with head and lace. Toasted caramel spice and old citrus aroma. Taosted caramel peachy malts with some taosted nuts and very dry soft fruity spicy finish. Medium bosy and very soft carbo. Probably would have been better fresh, but still good.
beer_name: Mikkeller Imperial India Pale Ale Mosaic

review_blob: Bottle from Meditrina. Wicked clear gold with small head and a little lace. Tropical fruit apricot lemony funk mint grassy woody aroma. Apricot tropical fruit sweetness with a touch of peach and champagne and honey tangy tart drying grassy funky mild bitter dry finish with a little lingering funk woodiness. Medium light nicely attenuated with nice lively fine carbo.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Clear copper dense lasting head and lace. Tropical fruit and toffee and spice aroma. Tropical fruit and toffee sweetness with a hint of nuts assertive spicy bitterness with a hint of citrus and some lingering non-cloying toffee in the finish. Medium body very soft. Excellent. Hard to believe this might be a year old?

Bottle from Richmond Market. Murky golden orange with lasting head and lace. Tangerine grapefruit and melon aroma with some spice. Orange tropical grassy sweetness with assertive grapefruit bite on lively carbo medium light body and very dry finish. Wicked fuckin excellent.
beer_name: Frost Beer Works The Other IPA

review_blob: Bottle from Toable and Vine. Hazy golden orange with head lace and a few floaties. Strong citrus and pine aroma. Nice fruity sweetness with some light grains and assertive citrusy long bitterness. Nicely attenuate medium light body. Really tastes like an IPA without being gooey or underattenuated. Wicked underrated IMHO

Bottle from Richmond Market. Hazy copper with dense head and lace.. Fairly mild aroma of biscuit spice and citrus. Peachy biscuity malts with some medium spicy peppery citrus bitterness enhanced by lively carbo. Medium body. Solid but unspectacular.

On tap at Black Back Pub. Hazy pale golden orange with lasting head and lace. Orange citrus aroma some spice. Scent of an orange San pelligrino. Mild peachy apricot sweetness with some grassiness. Citrus rind and spice bitterness with long weird spicy herbal finish. Light body soft carbo.

On tap at black back pub. Pale hazy yellow gold with lasting head and lace. Tropical fruit and mild funk aroma. Tropical fruit pineapple grainy malt sweetness. Spicy peppery bitterness and mild Bretty funk. Dry finish. Medium light body. Soft carbo. Fucking excellent.

Can at black back pub. Very pale yellow straw color with small head. Lemon pastry and floral and spice aroma. Tropical fruit grassy sweetness medium citrus rind and spice bitterness dry finish medium light body soft lively carbo.

Can from Meditrina. New updated version. Hazy golden orange with small head and some lace. Piney spicy aroma with hints of tangerine and toffe and some cereal and nuts. Peachy sweetness with toffee (or butterscotch, not sure). Assertive piney resiny bitter long finish. Medium full body. Fairly lively carbo. Decent enough. Not sure how it can stand up to a state thats already crowded with awesome IPAs.

2014 bottle. Clear gold with ring. Tart aroma with a hint of honey and white wine. Fairly tart apricot sweetness with some cheesy funk a hint of leather and lingering fruit. Light and fairly lively. I think I tend to like low-rated Berliners better than high rated one. Not a favorite style.

On tap at Grand Cru last night. Very pale mostly cloudy with no head, probably because Grand Crus glassware is filthy, bubbles stuck all over the sides of the class. Mildly spicy tangy citrus aroma. Mildly sweet and fruity tangy wheaty malt with risp dry mildly spicy finish. Light and very refreshing. Would like to try this again out of a clean glass.

Squealer from Brewfest. Clear copper with lasting head and lace. Not sure which version. A little pine and spice aroma. Caramel peachy sweetness with nutty toasted malt and medium assertive citrus and pepper and pine resin bitterness and dry finish. Medium body. Lively carbo with a little bite. Good but doesnt stack up to whats available around here IMHO.

Can from Brewfest. Almost clear almost copper with dense head and lace. Citrus and pine aroma. Peachy and cereal malt and slightly nutty malts and citrus and pine resin fairly dry finish lingering bitterness. Medium light body. Some lingering mustiness. Not as hoppy or dry as Grants IPA which was a classic back then. Seems more like a 2016 version of 1980s IPA. Still very good.

Can from Brewfest. Hazy golden orange with dense head and lace. Potent citrus tangerine melon grassy aroma. Tropical fruit and grassy crackery malts with mild citrus bitterness and dry fruity hop finish. Medium light body nicely attenuated and very soft carbo. Wicked fucking excellent. I could drink a truckload of these.

Bottle from Brewtopia. Hazy golden orange with small head and lace. Powerful lemon tangerine apricot fruity hop aroma with a touch of toffee. Apricot toffee mild sweetness with medium citrus rind and grassy bitterness and very dry finish. Medium body and very soft carbo. Excellent .

Bottle from Table and Vine. Pure clear gold with lasting ring and lace. Lemon pixie stix pastry and melon aroma. Tropical fruit melon sweetness with strong grassy grain and citrus spice assertive tart dry grassy finish. Medium light body and very fine carb. Not really what I was in the mood for, but surprisingly delicious.

Bottle from Whole Foods. Amber brown with big eggshell head and lace. Smoky brown sugar ash woody bready aroma. Toasted brown sugar maple syrup sweetness with subdued fruit and nuts and smoky caramelized nutty dry finish with a touch of woody hops. Medium body and soft carbonation. Fucking brilliant...and extra points for being only $7.99 for 750.

Okay, this is categorized as a wheat ale even though it says hefeweizen on the label, which is appropriate because as a hefe it is fucking terrible and almost all American "wheat ales" are terrible. Nice cloudy orange straw with lasting head and lace. Mild honey malt aroma. Light honey malt sweetness with a little grassiness and green grapes and a little wheat tang and a lot of water. WTF? Very watery tasting. Very very little flavor. Light body (which is okay with me) and fairly soft. Just fucking flavorless. JESUS. Drain.

Bottle from Brewtopia. CLoudy golden orange with lasting head and lace. Clovey spicy aroma with some wheat tang and light banana. Peachy malt with grass and wheaty tang and fairly long assertive spicy citrus mineral grassy bitterness. Medium light fairly soft body. I like my hefes sweeter with more banan esters and less bite in the finish. Had high hopes for this. Oh well, back to Paulaner even though its not as fresh.

Bottle from Brewtopia. Orange copper with lasting head and lace. Piney spicy aroma with some caramel and orange. Toasted caramel nutty sweetness with peachy sweetness and piney resin bitterness with some overripe fruit. Medium full soft body Very old school IMHO. Not what Im liking these days.

Bottle from Meditrina. Slight hazy orange gold with lasting head and lace. Nice fresh citrus floral and spice aroma. Toffee and grassy malts with some orange peach apricot. Assertive pine resin and citrus rind long bitterness in dry finish. Medium light body lively carbo to accentuate hops. Possible more bitter than required but still delicious. Guess I gotta save some for the wife. Shell dig it.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Golden with head and a little...aw fuck...okay I finished it before I got to doing this. Anyhow, that means it was good. It had a little toasty malts and nice spicy bitterness with a little citrus and didnt suffer from wateriness due to low alcohol. Very good.

Bottle from Brewtopia. Clear amber with lasting eggshell head and lace. Citrus and woody hops aroma with some caramel. Mildly toasted caramel and some ripe cherry sweetness with some roasted nuts and some old orangy bitterness. Decently dry medium body. A little slick. Pretty good. Worth drinking but I wish it was a 12 ounce so I could move on to something else because my wife wouldnt drink this. Not up to her level of IPA perfection.
beer_name: Heavy Seas / Maine Beer Partner Ships Red IPA

review_blob: Bottle from Brewtopia. Golden with very slight haze and small head. Surprising toffee green grape light citrus aroma. Medium toffee stone fruit bready malt sweetness with very spicy bitterness and long old fruit finish. Not at all what I expected. Perhaps they did a full boil with a lot of the hops instead of pitching for aroma, etc, at the finish. Not sure. Anyhow, probably the most unpleasant mosaic beer Ive had. Long Trail Smash Mosiac/Maris Otter is much better.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Bottle from Table and Vine. Hazy gold with lasting head and lace. Citrus floral leafy bready aroma. Mild tropical fruit mango apricot grassy sweetness with just a little cereal and pine and citrus and spicy bitterness in dry finish. Medium body and enough carbo to accentuate the hops without a bit. Just fuckiing great. So many amazing IPAs out there. They all deserve my love.
beer_name: The Hop Concept Galaxy & Comet IPA

review_blob: Can from Brewtopia. Clear gold with lasting white head and lace. Fresh unripe citrus and spice aroma. Peachy cereal and nuts sweetness with classic East Coast spice and toffee dry finish. Medium body and lively carbo to accentuate hops. Very good sessionable pale ale.

Can from Table and Vine. Pale gold with lasting white head and lace. Tropical fruit bread tangerine melon aroma. Tropical fruit apricot pineapple sweetness with ahint of honey and crackery malt. Hop flavored finish fruity and dry but not bitter. This is the classic tropical (Vermont) IPA. Nicely attenuated medium light body with just enough carbo to accentuate hops. Drinks much lighter than 8%. Ive had session IPAs that were heavier. Totally fucking in awesome. Wish I was in CO so I could enjoy this with some bud.

Bottle from Brewtopia. Gold with slight haze lasting head and lace. Fruity tangerine melon mango aroma with a little spicy yeast. Fruity mild tangerine melon sweetness with a little grassiness flavorful hoppy finish with some mild spicy rindy bitterness. Pretty dry. NIcely attenuated medium light body and very soft Belgian mouthfeel. Slightly midler than, say, Stillwater Why Cant IBU, but totally fuckin excellent. Glad I bought a four pack instead of the usual single. MOAR!!!

Bottle from Brwetopia. Clear amber with nice head and lace. Weird aroma of leafy hops caramel and a touch of mint. Sweet roasted caramel dominates with some ginger snap cookies and spicy grassy finish. Medium body slightly slick. At first sip I didnt like it but it gets better.
beer_name: Two Roads Henrys Farm Double Bock

review_blob: Bottle from Table and Vine. Dark brown with lasting dense head and lace. Roasted caramel and nuts aroma. Burnt caramel nuts ash chocolate with very dry raosted coffee bitter finish. Medium light body fairly soft. Seems to lack any enticing malt quality. Its just burnt bitter and gone. Anyhow...I finished it so it gets a 3 or above.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Pale cloudy orange with white head. Strong lemony spicy aroma. Tart lemony with very little bready honey sweetness with tart milky lemon rind finish with lingering slick lemon peel and bitter spice. Light body. Soft slick carbo. Drinkable but not very pleasant. Definitely sticking to traditional orange peel and coriander wits this summer.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Hazy yellow straw gold with lasting head and lace. Citrus orange wheaty tangy bubble gum and banana aroma. Tropical fruit pineapple sweetness with a hint of vanilla and wheaty tang with mild citrus and spice finish. Medium wheaty body and very soft carbo. Extremely refreshing and delicious. Excellent.
beer_name: Ommegang Game of Thrones #6 - Seven Kingdoms

review_blob: Bottle from Table and Vine. Hazy golden straw with dense head and lace. MInty grassy pine aroma. Mild peachy sweetness light grassy hay with assertive but some delicate pine and citrus and spice dry finish. Medium light body and lively to accentuate hops. Not world-breaking but very good/excellent, and Im glad because I was getting ready to give up on one of the original micros, especially after their wretched double IPA version of this.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Bright gold with very fine haze dense white head and lace. Pungent citrus tangerine grapefruit pineapple aroma with a little grass. Tropical fruit apricot pineapple sweetness with a little grassy and a hint of crackery malt with assertive citrus graefruity tangerine bitter dry finish. Might body and lively carbonation accentuate hops. I could drink this all fucking day and night and the net morning. Fucking amazing.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Black with dense tan head and lace. Roasted steamed milk coffee aroma with mild woody hops. Very rich coffee espresso chocolate sweetness with just enough fruit to not ruin it. Roasted bitter coffee finish with a very pleasant fresh hoppiness leafy green. Full body rich low carbo. I am so fucking sick of coffee beers that I never would have bought this -- in fact I didnt several times -- if I had remembered that it had coffee in it. Anyhow...surprise...its fucking delicious.

Bottle from Table and Vine. If I knew it had so much shit in it, I wouldnt have bought it. Copper orange with ring. Honey toffee clove aroma. Sweet honey some cereal some peachy old orangey fruitiness with kinda gross herbal bitterness. Medium full body. Lacks the nice soft mouthfeel of a good tripel. Actually not as bad I expected after reading whats in it. But still bad. When I bought it, I saw "Belgian-style tripel" and I was like wow Dogfish made a tripel. I should have known there would be all kinds of crap in it to disguise that its a shitty tripel. Drain.
beer_name: Dogfish Head Beer To Drink Music To

review_blob: Bottle from Meditrina. Clear golden with lasting head and lace. Pine and graprefruit bready aroma with a touch of honey. Short peachy nutty biscuit sweetness with assertive grapefruit rind and pine bitterness. Medium body lively carbo. Old school, but Very good/Excellent.

Bottle from Meditrina. Hazy golden yellow with lasting head and lots of lace. Incredible grapefruit pineapple tangerine canteloupe aroma. Tropical fruit apricot pineapple sweetness with just a touch of cereal with grapefruity spicy bitter dry finish. Medium body soft carbonation enough to accentuate hops and aroma. Just fucking amazing. One of the best IPAs. Might be better than Pieces of Eight. INSANE!

Bottle from...dont know. Black with tan head. Aromas of chocolate, earth, ash, and wet paint. Sweet chocolately sugary with some dark friut. Harsh spicy bitterness and alcohol. Slightly cloying. Full body. Unpleasant.

Bottle from Brewtopia. Gold with head and some lace. Surprisingly mild floral honey orange aroma without much coriander. Very sweet honey and orange syrup with some light cereal and herbal bitter long and slightly cloying finish. Medium full sticky body and low carbo. Well, you win some and you pour some down the drain. This is a mess. Gross.

Bottle from Brewtopia. opaque caramel color with lasting head and full lace. Weird cherry tobacco wood bready grassy aroma. Mild toasted toffee sweetness with some peachy fruitiness. Very mild but dry finish. A Soft and a touch watery. Very difficult to describe (but I wouldnt call it a dubbel). Anyhow, the flavors are weird and complex but enticing. Though I cant pin it down, I see no reason not to enjoy it.
